section.title: Flashlight Maven Plugin
section.para: If your project uses Apache Maven, Flashlight provides a plugin that can help you produce instrumented versions of your jar or war files. You can get the plugin from the main menu by selecting Sierra | Save Maven Plugin As... from the main menu. This will save a zip file in the location of your choosing that, when unzipped, inflates to a repository named flashlight-repo containing our plugin and its dependencies.

The simplest way to add the plugin to a project is to add the repository to pom.xml file in your project. If you have more than one project that makes use of sierra, you may find it more useful to add the repository to an active profile, as described here.
The Flashlight plugin currently only has one goal, flashlight:instrument-archive, with the following configuration attributes:

row.entry: The location of the Flashlight data directory. This directory will be used to store the results of any runs performed with the instrumented archive.

section.para: Running this goal will crack open the jar or war file produced by mvn package. It then instruments its contents and outputs a new archive file that can be dropped into any commonly used web server or, in the case of an executable jar, run from the command line. The output file can be found in the target folder and will be named <project>-<version>.inst.<packaging>.
